Returns: PositionableRecyclerViewAction a new ViewAction focused on a particular position.
Parameters: int: a 0-based index into the list of matching elements within the RecyclerView.
atPosition(int).Description: Returns a new ViewAction which will cause the ViewAction to operate upon the position-th element which the matcher has selected.

ClassDesc: Most RecyclerViewActions are given a matcher to select a particular view / viewholder within the RecyclerView. In this case the default behaviour is to expect that the matcher matches 1 and only one item within the RecyclerView. This interface gives users the ability to override that type of behaviour and explicitly select an item in the RecyclerView at a given position. This is similar to on the onData(...).atPosition() api for AdapterViews.
